item.title: Apex Legends Ending Support for Nintendo Switch 1 in August
item.content:encoded:
Apex Legends will end service for the original Nintendo Switch on August 4. The Nintendo Switch 2 version of the game, which launched in August 2025, will remain live.

Respawn Entertainment, via EA‘s official website, announced that season 29 will be the final update for Nintendo Switch, with all future updates continuing on the console’s successor. Season 30 begins on August 4.

The development team stressed that all progress, purchases, and earnings are tied to players’ individual EA accounts, and everything will carry over to Nintendo Switch 2, regardless of when you purchase the console. It also stressed that the game will continue to be supported on all other platforms and that the reason for the switch, no pun intended, is to deliver the best possible experience and utilize the power of the Switch 2.

“Our goal is to deliver a high-quality experience. Thanks to Nintendo’s investment in the Nintendo Switch 2, the platform offers a great handheld experience for Apex Legends.”

The Original Nintendo Switch Continues Its Sunset

As 2026 will be the first full calendar year with the Nintendo Switch 2 on the market, the transition away from the original Switch continues. Nintendo recently held a dedicated Direct to Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream. This is one of the final games designed specifically for the original Nintendo Switch, and it will also be playable on the Nintendo Switch 2.

Additionally, major Nintendo releases such as Super Mario Bros. Wonder are receiving dedicated editions for the new Switch 2, adding enhanced visuals and new modes, further encouraging players to switch over. The Switch 2 had a successful 2025, leading the market in hardware sales for December. Learn more about that here.

Do you currently play Apex Legends on the Nintendo Switch? Have you already purchased a Switch 2? Tell us more in our official Discord server.

For more on the push to get players to adopt current-gen consoles, see this subtle message Sony has sent to PlayStation 4 users. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Highguard Adds 5v5 Raid, Playable Now
item.content:encoded:
Highguard has added a new gameplay mode, now available to play.

Highguard has added a 5v5 Raid Mode. The mode is now live, but it will be available for a limited time. The mode is experimental and is only playable this weekend. It’s a separate playlist and will not replace the 3v3 raids.

Lobbies have been updated to allow for parties of 5 for the weekend. Additionally, in this mode, Raids are now 10 lives instead of 6, and respawns are slightly longer to allow for generators to be planted or diffused.

A new base has also been added to Highguard. In addition to the new game mode, they have also added a new base, Soul Well. Described as a dark relic from a lost age, the new base has been added to the rotation in all game modes.

Quality-Of-Life Improvements Are Also Coming to Highguard in This Patch

Additionally, there are several updates for optimization and quality of life. Several optimizations improve animation performance, projectile behavior, and other gameplay systems. These updates benefit both console and PC and will also include features such as a motion blur toggle.

The developers note that players in 3v3 playlists should see some improvements, but they ask for some leeway during testing of the new game mode. Also, Firing Range does not currently support 5v5.

Learn more about the game, which received mostly negative reviews on Steam after a difficult launch, by checking out the full 2026 roadmap.

item.title: Sony Patents Adaptive Controller With Virtual Button Layouts
item.content:encoded:
Sony has patented a new controller type that could revolutionize how gamers think about what a controller can be.

According to a new patent dated January 27, 2026, Sony Interactive Entertainment is presenting a very forward-thinking adaptive controller. In the pack, they describe the drawbacks to modern video game controllers, including difficulties with fixed layouts. For example, they present a hypothetical scenario in which controllers are too large or too small for some users, and highlight the need for game controllers that support different configurations. They also discuss the desire for improvements in the placement of joysticks or D-pads

The drawing shows the layout of a typical controller without fixed buttons, but with a digital screen that allows customization. It also shows different button and D-pad placements, and notes that a button press can be recognized by different movements, such as a tap or swipe.

Sony Has Redefined Controllers in the Past

Sony has always been innovative with their controllers. The current standard of twin analog sticks began with the DualShock controller, which, in and of itself, was an advanced take on the original PlayStation controller. Later, they would innovate with Sixaxis motion-sensing technology in their PlayStation 3 controller. The PS4 added a touchpad, and the PS5 added haptic feedback and dynamic triggers.

While there’s no way to know whether this controller patent will be realized, it shows that Sony is considering ways to be inclusive and allow players to choose their own configurations and play their way.

Also, one could argue that, with the rise of mobile gaming, a younger generation is already accustomed to virtual gamepads. At the same time, it’s a leap into the future that may be difficult for some.

item.title: God of War Prime Video Series Reunites Game Actor With Mimir Role
item.content:encoded:
Three more names have been cast in the God of War series coming to Prime Video, including an actor who has voiced the character in the video games.

Variety reports that Alastair Duncan has been cast as Mimir in the upcoming God of War series. He previously voiced the character in the most recent God of War games. Additionally, Danny Woodburn and Jeff Gulka have been cast as Brok and Sindri.

Mimir is described as a cheery character with an expensive intellect and self-describes as the smartest man in the world. He will serve as the advisor to Odin, played in the series by Mandy Patinkin. Brok and Sindri are Dwarven blacksmiths

More on the Cast of the Forthcoming God of War Series

In addition to these three announcements, it has been previously confirmed that Ryan Hurst will play Kratos. He previously voiced Thor in the God of War: Ragnarök video game. Also, Teresa Palmer will play Thor’s wife, Sif, in the series. Speaking of Thor, Ólafur Darri Ólafsson will be portraying the God of Thunder.

Prime Video’s God of War is Already Renewed for Season 2

Amazon renewed the series for a second season. and production is expected to begin in February 2026. As of now, there’s no word on when the series will premiere. Insider Gaming will continue to monitor the story and report any and all updates.

Are you excited for the upcoming show? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: GALLERY: First WWE 2K26 Screenshots Released
item.content:encoded:
The features for WWE 2K26 have officially been revealed, and with that comes the first batch of screenshots for the game.

The screenshots give players a look at new and updated character models, arenas, match types, and more.

WWE 2K26 launches on March 13 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC. The series is officially leaving the last-gen Xbox One and PlayStation 4 behind after over a decade.

This year’s game features CM Punk as the game’s main cover athlete and feature wrestler in the game’s Showcase Mode. Other improvements include four new and returning match types, Switch 2-specific features, and a number of updates to fan-favorite game modes.

“Run the show your way in WWE 2K26, featuring 400+ WWE Superstars and Legends,” the game’s description reads. “Light up the ring with all-new match types, relive CM Punk’s greatest moments, and explore the secrets of The Island.”

Speaking of the Island, the mode is officially coming to PC for the first time after skipping the platform in WWE 2K25.

As mentioned, WWE 2K26 launches on March 13. Those who preorder the higher-tiered editions of the game, however, get access to the game a week early on March 6.
